sentences: Lapsed on läinud kõigi nelja tuule poole.
Korjas oma kompsud kokku ja kadus kõigi nelja tuule poole.
Tuhk loobiti kõigi ilmakaarte poole laiali.
context: "Kõigi nelja tuule poole" is an Estonian expression meaning "to all four winds" or "in all directions." It's used when describing something that has scattered or spread out in multiple directions, similar to the English idiom "to the four winds." The phrase implies complete dispersal and lack of a specific destination. This expression is commonly used metaphorically to describe people going separate ways, things being scattered everywhere, or events unfolding without a clear pattern.
